intro: Schradera ligularis, commonly known as the slender schradera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish, and clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. Schradera ligularis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
